humanum_full_description_en:
From " wind " to " station " sound. The character " Taiwan " is not found in all kinds of calligraphy books. It is a later pictophonetic character. "Typhoons" refer to tropical cyclones in the western Pacific Ocean and the South China Sea. They often strike coastal areas in summer and autumn, and are extremely violent storms. The violent typhoons that have hit Hong Kong in recent years include "Haiyan" in 2015, "Hange" in 2017 and "Mangosteen" in 2018.

Before the Ming Dynasty, ancient books called typhoons "hurricanes." After the Ming Dynasty, they were divided into typhoons and hurricanes according to the magnitude of the wind. Wang Shizhen in the Qing Dynasty, "Xiangzu Notes": "Taiwan's wind is very different from other seas. The wind is strong and violent, it is a hurricane, and even Taiwan. The hurricane breaks rapidly, and Taiwan often continues day and night. Zheng, two, three, Those who send it in April are hurricanes, and those who send it in May, June, July, and August are Taiwan." See " Hurricane ".

In English, the western world's storm is generally called hurricane, and the Asian storm is called typhoon. According to The Shorter Oxford Dictionary , The Shorter Oxford Dictionary , the word typhoon was first recorded in 1588 and referred to as the Chinese translation of " ta feng , big wind [大风]". As to whether the "ta feng" referred to here is actually a "typhoon", it remains to be verified.
humanum_short_description_en: From " wind " to " station " sound. The character " Taiwan " is not found in all kinds of calligraphy books. It is a later pictophonetic character. "Typhoons" refer to tropical cyclones in the western Pacific Ocean and the South China Sea. They often strike coastal areas in summer and autumn, and are extremely violent storms.
humanum_full_description:
從「風」，「台」聲。「颱」字不見於各類字書，是後起的形聲字。「颱風」指太平洋西部海洋和南海海上的熱帶氣旋，常於夏季和秋季吹襲沿岸地區，是一種極猛烈的風暴。近年吹襲香港的猛烈颱風有2015年的「海燕」、2017年的「天鴿」和2018年的「山竹」等。

　　明代以前古書稱颱風為「颶風」，明代以後或按風力大小分為颱風和颶風。清代王士禛《香祖筆記》：「臺灣風信與他海殊異，風大而烈者為颶，又甚者為颱。颶倏發倏止，颱常連日夜不止。正、二、三、四月發者為颶，五、六、七、八月發者為颱。」參見「颶」。

　　英文把西方世界的風暴一般稱為 hurricane，而把亞洲之風暴稱作typhoon。據《牛津字典簡編》The Shorter Oxford Dictionary，typhoon一字，最早記載出於1588年，並指其為漢語 "ta feng, big wind [大風]"之翻譯。至於此中所指的 "ta feng" 會不會實即「颱風」，則有待考據了。
humanum_short_description: 從「風」，「台」聲。「颱」字不見於各類字書，是後起的形聲字。「颱風」指太平洋西部海洋和南海海上的熱帶氣旋，常於夏季和秋季吹襲沿岸地區，是一種極猛烈的風暴。

HSK 4: 檯,台,抬,臺,颱
(Simplified: 台)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: News 風 delivered from a platform 台
  • ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 風 [ fēng ] wind; air; customs, manners; news
    • 台 [ tái ] platform; unit; term of address
①高平的建築物：亭臺樓閣。
②像臺的東西，器物的座子：井臺。窗臺。燈臺。
③敬辭，用於稱呼對方或與對方有關的事物：臺鑒。臺甫。
④量詞：一臺戲。
⑤臺灣省的簡稱：臺胞。臺幣。
⑥桌子、案子：寫字檯。
⑦發生在太平洋西部熱帶海洋上的一種極猛烈的風暴，稱“颱風”。
⑧姓氏。

"Typhoons" refer to tropical cyclones in the western Pacific Ocean and the South China Sea. They often strike coastal areas in summer and autumn, and are extremely violent storms. The violent typhoons that have hit Hong Kong in recent years include "Haiyan" in 2015, "Hange" in 2017 and "Mangosteen" in 2018. Before the Ming Dynasty, ancient books called typhoons "hurricanes." After the Ming Dynasty, they were divided into typhoons and hurricanes according to the magnitude of the wind. Wang Shizhen in the Qing Dynasty, "Xiangzu Notes": "Taiwan's wind is very different from other seas. The wind is strong and violent, it is a hurricane, and even Taiwan. The hurricane breaks rapidly, and Taiwan often continues day and night. Zheng, two, three, Those who send it in April are hurricanes, and those who send it in May, June, July, and August are Taiwan." See " Hurricane". In English, the western world's storm is generally called hurricane, and the Asian storm is called typhoon. According to The Shorter Oxford Dictionary, The Shorter Oxford Dictionary, the word typhoon was first recorded in 1588 and referred to as the Chinese translation of " ta feng, big wind [大风]".
